item.title: By: Holger
item.dc:creator: Holger
item.description:
It seems you run in the same problem with heatmaps and objects. The circle seems to be not antialiased. I generate heatmaps as well (e.g. fighter jets flyovers) and the frame of the military training space and the on air fueling ovals look ugly. Any idea how to make them look better?
Example: http://fluglaerm-kl.de/pics/heatmap_2019.png
item.content:encoded:
It seems you run in the same problem with heatmaps and objects. The circle seems to be not antialiased. I generate heatmaps as well (e.g. fighter jets flyovers) and the frame of the military training space and the on air fueling ovals look ugly. Any idea how to make them look better?

Example:
http://fluglaerm-kl.de/pics/heatmap_2019.png

item.title: By: Rainald62
item.dc:creator: Rainald62
item.description: Nice work. Just one suggestion: The z-values of the dummy points are less important if these points are far away (at the corners of a large triangle instead of a bounding square).
item.content:encoded: Nice work. Just one suggestion: The z-values of the dummy points are less important if these points are far away (at the corners of a large triangle instead of a bounding square).
